com.aheaditec.apdu

Class ApduProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aheaditec.apdu.ApduProvider

  • public class ApduProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides basic cards operations.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        @Nullable
public static ApduProvider getInstance()
        This method is used for getting instance of this class if instance was already created. Null otherwise. For initialization call initializeSession(CardConnection, InitializeCallback) method.
        Returns:
        Instance of the ApduProvider class or null.

      • initializeSession

        public static void initializeSession(@NonNull
                                     com.aheaditec.wrapper.interfaces.CardConnection cardConnection,
                                     @NonNull
                                     InitializeCallback callback)
        This method initializes ApduProvider with given applet. First of all selection of applet is performed, than card signature is verified with public key. In case of success, ApduProvider is return through InitializeCallback.onSuccess(ApduProvider), in case of fail, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        cardConnection - Implementation of CardConnection which provides communication with the card.
        callback - Callback which contains returning methods.

      • finalizeSession

        public void finalizeSession(@NonNull
                            EmptyCallback callback)
        This method is used to reset session with the card. This method includes two types of reset. The first type (soft - in scope of SDK) calls reselection of the applet. Reselection of the applet destroys session keys for SM, session PIN token and unverify the PIN objects. The second type of reset (hard - out of scope of SDK) calls CardConnection.reset() to reset to card. This reset is implemented out of scope of this SDK and we cannot guarantee its validity. The soft reset prevents of exploit in case of bad hard reset implementation. In case of success, EmptyCallback.onSuccess() is returned. Otherwise BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        callback - EmptyCallback callback which contains returning method of this operation.

      • getCardID

        public void getCardID(@NonNull
                      ByteArrayCallback callback)
        This method retrieve CardID from the card. CardID is 16 bytes long identifier of the card. In case of success, response of the operation is return using ByteArrayCallback.onSuccess(byte[]) callback, in other case BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        callback - ByteArrayCallback which contains returning methods for this operation.

      • getContainerList

        public void getContainerList(@NonNull
                             ContainerListCallback callback)
        This method is used to get list of containers on the card. In case of success, list of container is returned in ContainerListCallback.onSuccess(List) callback. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        callback - ContainerListCallback instance which contains returning method for this operation.

      • getCertificate

        public void getCertificate(@NonNull
                           ContainerBasic container,
                           @NonNull
                           CertificateCallback callback)
        This method is used to get certificate of container. Beware that container doesn't have to have certificate included. Certificate is only optional. In case of missing certificate, use getPublicKey(ContainerBasic, PublicKeyCallback) method instead. In case of success, CertificateCallback.onSuccess(Certificate) is returned. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        container - ContainerBasic object representing desired container.
        callback - CertificateCallback containing returning method for this operation.

      • getPublicKey

        public void getPublicKey(@NonNull
                         ContainerBasic container,
                         @NonNull
                         PublicKeyCallback callback)
        This method is used to get public key of the container. In case of success, PublicKeyCallback.onSuccess(PublicKey) is returned. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        container - ContainerBasic object representing desired container.
        callback - PublicKeyCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • verifySignature

        public void verifySignature(@NonNull
                            ContainerBasic container,
                            @NonNull
                            AlgorithmID algID,
                            @NonNull
                            byte[] plainData,
                            @NonNull
                            byte[] signature,
                            @NonNull
                            VerifySignatureCallback callback)
        This method verifies signature generated by this SDK. This method should be used only for background check, if the generated signature is correct. Verifiers are implemented using spongy castle methods which may be platform dependent. In case of success, VerifySignatureCallback.onResponse(boolean) is returned, where boolean represents validity of signature. In case of error during communication or inside of SDK, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        container - ContainerBasic object which was used during signing.
        algID - AlgorithmID element which was used during signing.
        plainData - Byte array containing plain data (data to be signed).
        signature - Byte array containing signature (signed data according to algID).
        callback - VerifySignatureCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • verify

        public void verify(@NonNull
                   VerifyCodes pinReference,
                   @NonNull
                   byte[] pin,
                   boolean generateSessionPin,
                   @NonNull
                   VerifyCallback callback)
        This method can be used in two different ways according to generateSessionPin parameter. The first way is classic verify mode. In this mode, user is verified towards the card with included PIN. The second way is generate session pin mode. In this mode, the included PIN is used to generate session PIN (byte array token), user can use this generated PIN to verify to the card. Generated PIN has the same scope as the session PIN reference. Beware that not every PIN object supports session PIN. This can be find out using getPinInfo(VerifyCodes, PinInfoCallback) method and if the session PIN is generated, verification is done using verifyUsingSessionPin(VerifyCodes, byte[], VerifyCallback) method. In case of success, VerifyCallback.onVerified() is returned is classic verification mode, VerifyCallback.onSessionPinGenerated(byte[]) is returned in case of generate session pin mode. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pinReference - VerifyCodes enum element defining type of PIN object.
        pin - Array of bytes containing data with PIN (plain and not padded).
        generateSessionPin - Boolean expression which states, if sessionPin should be generated.
        callback - VerifyCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • verifyUsingSessionPin

        public void verifyUsingSessionPin(@NonNull
                                  VerifyCodes pinReference,
                                  @NonNull
                                  byte[] pin,
                                  @NonNull
                                  VerifyCallback callback)
        This method is used when verifying with session PIN. Session PIN is bounded to the PIN object defined in VerifyCodes enum. Beware that not always and not for every PIN objects session PIN is defined. For more information follow javadoc for verify(VerifyCodes, byte[], boolean, VerifyCallback) method. In case of success, VerifyCallback.onVerified() is returned. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pinReference - VerifyCodes enum element to which session PIN is bounded.
        pin - Byte array containing session PIN.
        callback - VerifyCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • unverify

        public void unverify(@NonNull
                     VerifyCodes pinReference,
                     @NonNull
                     EmptyCallback callback)
        This method unverifies given PIN object. In case of success, EmptyCallback.onSuccess() is returned, otherwise BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pinReference - VerifyCodes PIN object which we want to unverify.
        callback - EmptyCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • isVerified

        public void isVerified(@NonNull
                       VerifyCodes pinReference,
                       @NonNull
                       VerifyCallback callback)
        Method checks if user is authenticated with given PIN object. In case of success, VerifyCallback.onVerified() is returned. In case of failure, BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pinReference - VerifyCodes enum element defining PIN object.
        callback - VerifyCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • getPinInfo

        public void getPinInfo(@NonNull
                       VerifyCodes pinReference,
                       @NonNull
                       PinInfoCallback callback)
        This method gets information about PIN object. Those information determines properties of the PIN object, ie. try counter, unblock counter, support of session PIN and others. In case of success, PinInfoCallback.onSuccess(PinInfoBasic) is returned, in case of failure BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        pinReference - VerifyCodes enum element defining desired PIN object.
        callback - PinInfoCallback containing returning methods for this operation.

      • signData

        public void signData(@NonNull
                     ContainerBasic container,
                     @NonNull
                     byte[] data,
                     @NonNull
                     AlgorithmID algID,
                     @NonNull
                     SignatureCallback callback)
        This method signs data given by the user to the card, with specified container which holds private key, specified algorithm from AlgorithmID enum. If the user is not verified to the card with the PIN object bind to the container (usually PIN for classic signature, QPIN for qualified signature), the SignatureCallback.onVerificationNeeded(VerifyCodes, SignatureContinueCallback) is used to ask user for a PIN. Then the PIN is passed back to the SDK with SignatureContinueCallback.In case of successful signing operation ByteArrayCallback.onSuccess(byte[]) is returned, otherwise BasicCallback.onFail(StatusWord) or BasicCallback.onInternalError(InternalErrors) is returned.
        Parameters:
        container - ContainerBasic object specifying container to sign with.
        data - Byte array containing plain data to be signed.
        algID - AlgorithmID specifier of algorithm to be used.
        callback - ApduCallback which holds ReaderResponse object containing reader and card states, and signedData (if successful), when operation finishes.
